decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings: 0650/S/01 (Location & Block Plans), 0650/S/02 Rev A (Proposed Site Plan, 0650/P/09 Rev A (Proposed Garden Store) and Arboricultural Impact Assessment and Method Statement (ref: CAS/2022/110) prepared by Cantia Arboricultural Services.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those detailed within the approved drawings listed under condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The detached outbuilding hereby approved shall be used only for domestic purposes incidental to the dwelling on this site, and shall not be used for separate habitable accommodation, letting or any commercial use. No cooking or kitchen facilities shall be installed at any time.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Other than the tree identified in the Arboricultural Impact Assessment and Method Statement (CAS/2022/110) prepared by Cantia Arboricultural Services, no trees, shrubs or hedges within, or in proximity of, the site shall be felled, uprooted, wilfully damaged or destroyed, cut back in any way or removed without previous written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Any trees, shrubs or hedges removed without consent or dying or being severely damaged or becoming seriously diseased within 5 years from the completion of the development hereby permitted shall be replaced with shrubs or hedge plants or similar species capable of achieving a comparable size unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To ensure the retention of trees of value in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with Ealing SPG 9, policy 5.10 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies SI 1, SI 2 and G7 of the London Plan (2021). | All tree protection measures outlined in the Arboricultural Impact Assessment and Method Statement (CAS/2022/110) prepared by Cantia Arboricultural Services shall be fully implemented prior to the commencement of the development (including site clearance and demolition) and shall be retained for the duration of the construction works.

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with Ealing SPG 9, policy 5.10 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies SI 1, SI 2 and G7 of the London Plan (2021).
description: Single storey detached rear outbuilding; landscaping and removal of 1no. cherry tree in rear garden
